meanings.sent1: The biocatalytic reaction helped break down the organic matter.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the biocatalytic process in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The biocatalytic enzymes were like tiny helpers in the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: Her biocatalytic approach to problem-solving was innovative and effective.
meanings.sent5: The biocatalytic properties of the enzyme made it a valuable tool in biotechnology.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a biocatalyst.
meanings.sent1: The biocatalytic substance enhanced the reaction rate.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered new biocatalytic properties in the enzyme.
meanings.sent3: The biocatalytic agent worked tirelessly to speed up the process.
meanings.sent4: His biocatalytic research opened up new possibilities in biochemistry.
meanings.sent5: The biocatalytic nature of the protein made it essential for the reaction to occur.

meanings.sent1: The biocatalytic pathway offered a more eco-friendly solution.
meanings.sent2: Companies are investing in biocatalytic technologies for sustainable production.
meanings.sent3: The biocatalytic approach proved to be both efficient and environmentally friendly.
meanings.sent4: The biocatalytic method revolutionized the way we approach chemical synthesis.
meanings.sent5: The biocatalytic system showed great promise in reducing waste and improving efficiency.
